creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
There are already some Ant tasks for subversion in the wild, for example

http://subclipse.tigris.org/svnant.html
http://tmate.org/svn/ant.html

Also I've started to play a little with providing a command line wrapper similar
to Ant's CVS tasks.  <svn>, <revisiondiff> (was <cvstagdiff>) and <changelog> are
rough, but ready.  You can find them in the propsal/sandbox/svn directory of Ant's
CVS HEAD, if you are interested.  They most likely require a CVS HEAD version of
Ant right now.

creator: j_a_fernandez@yahoo.com
text:
I would love if this sandbox could use a sort of facade pattern that would
allow support for different SVN engines to plug inside.
You are providing an svn.exe kind of engine. But we may be able to convince 
others to provide "pure java engines" or "JNI engines" so people can plug the 
one best for their environments.

What do people think????

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Jose Alberto, you are more than welcome to contribute to it ;-)

Actually, it wouldn't be too hard to turn AbstractSvnTask into such a facade,
although the parsers for the changelog and tag/revisiondiff tasks also rely on the
format of the output generated by the command line - this would be harder to hide.

creator: rwinston@eircom.net
text:
I have started writing an Ant task based on the JavaSVN library. It's still in a
raw stage, but you can see the latest in-progress cut at
http://www.researchkitchen.co.uk/blog/archives/11.

It currently supports update, checkout, and limited commit. Hopefully, it will
soon support most SVN commands - they seem to be well supported by the
underlying JavaSVN library. It's nice, because you don't have to resort to
exec()'ing svn.exe  - it's 100% Java. 

Any suggestions welcome - it may be added to the JavaSVN repository at some
stage, and if there's any interest in adding it to Ant when it becomes more
mature, all the better.

The svn antlib is providing a wrapper for svn cli
command in the same way as the cvs support in main-line ant.
